intervention_catalogue.name: Community Led Initiatives (CLI) - peer support
intervention_catalogue.short_description: CLI provide intensive peer support to people on probation, offering emotional and practical support to help with recovery and reduce the risk of reoffending.
long_description: CLI provide intensive peer support to people on probation, offering emotional and practical support to help with recovery and reduce the risk of reoffending.
intervention_catalogue.session_detail: The type, number and length of sessions can vary, depending on the location.

possible_outcomes: CLI peer support services are personalised based on the complexity of the individual’s needs. Depending on the needs, the aim is to achieve one or more of the following outcomes:
• getting access to things like a doctor, dentist, mental health support and help with drugs and alcohol
• helping with finances, benefits and debt
• understanding housing benefit support and the housing system
• building routine and structure with positive activities in the community
• accessing employment support in the community
• feeling supported and empowered to change direction
